title: A Step-By-Step Guide to Crafting a Gun In Minecraft

steps.title: Gather your resources.
steps.content: Gather your resources. You will need 6 blocks, 1 dispenser, 3 redstone, 4 redstone torches, a lever, and arrows.

steps.title: Place your dispenser, a redstone dust behind it, and 2 blocks behind that.
steps.content: Place your dispenser, a redstone dust behind it, and 2 blocks behind that.

steps.title: Place a block above-left and above-right of your rear blocks.
steps.content: Place a block above-left and above-right of your rear blocks.

steps.title: Place redstone torches on the sides of your bottom rear blocks (4 total).
steps.content: Place redstone torches on the sides of your bottom rear blocks (4 total).

steps.title: Put redstone dust in the channel on top of your rear bottom blocks.
steps.content: Put redstone dust in the channel on top of your rear bottom blocks. It should start flashing.

steps.title: Place a lever on the back of the rearmost bottom block, and turn it on.
steps.content: Place a lever on the back of the rearmost bottom block, and turn it on. This turns the machine "on", but stops the dispenser from firing.

steps.title: Fill your machine gun with ammo (either arrows or fire charges).
steps.content: Fill your machine gun with ammo (either arrows or fire charges).

steps.title: Prepare for war.
steps.content: Prepare for war. You can play with random Minecraft users and your friends from different devices by creating servers. [1] X Research source You can use a Minecraft pocket edition server. It is a Minecraft world on the mobile version of the game. [2] X Research source You can even create large servers to play minigames. [3] X Research source
